title: Consuelo Mack
text:
Consuelo Mack (née Cotter, born 30 November 1949 in <a href="New%20York%2C%20New%20York">New York, New York</a>) is an American business news journalist and host of "WealthTrack", a news program presented by <a href="WLIW-TV">WLIW-TV</a> in <a href="New%20York%20City">New York City</a>, distributed by <a href="American%20Public%20Television">American Public Television</a>, and aired weekly, primarily on <a href="PBS">PBS</a>-TV station affiliates. 
Before developing WealthTrack, she spent over a decade at "<a href="The%20Wall%20Street%20Journal">The Wall Street Journal</a>" as the Anchor and Managing Editor of "The <a href="Wall%20Street%20Journal%20Report">Wall Street Journal Report</a>", since hosted by <a href="Maria%20Bartiromo">Maria Bartiromo</a> and <a href="Rebecca%20Quick">Rebecca Quick</a>. During her tenure, it won the <a href="Overseas%20Press%20Club">Overseas Press Club</a> award.
Early life and education.
Mack grew up in <a href="Weston%2C%20Massachusetts">Weston, Massachusetts</a>, and studied at the <a href="Concord%20Academy">Concord Academy</a>. 
She attended <a href="Sarah%20Lawrence%20College">Sarah Lawrence College</a> and graduated in 1972 with a bachelor's degree in English Literature, History, and Political Science. 
After college, Mack was a trainee in the account-executive program of Merrill Lynch, Pierce, Fenner & Smith, stockbrokers. 
In 1974, she married lawyer Walter Staunton Mack, Jr.
